title: Dynamic Programming â€“ Patterns, Mental Models, and Traps
description: Dynamic Programming (DP) is a method for solving complex problems by breaking them down into simpler subproblems and storing the results of subproblems to avoid redundant work.
coreMentalModel: Break the problem into overlapping subproblems.
Store results of subproblems (memoization or tabulation).
Build up the solution from base cases.
keyPoints: Optimal substructure and overlapping subproblems are required.
State definition is the hardest part.

corePatterns.mentalModel: dp[i] = best answer for i-th subproblem.
corePatterns.template: for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) { dp[i] = ... }

corePatterns.mentalModel: dp[i][j] = best answer for subproblem (i, j).
corePatterns.template: for (let i = 0; i < m; i++) { for (let j = 0; j < n; j++) { dp[i][j] = ... } }

corePatterns.mentalModel: dp[i] = best answer using first i elements.

mutationRules.whyMemoize: Avoid recomputation of the same subproblem.
mutationRules.commonFix: Use a cache (object or array) to store results.
